result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher B. Pitts

records.addlTxt: Per Br 2 JA - any cash bond in 22CF391, 22CF385, 22CF311 held pending sentencing in 20CF1189,20CF503 and 22CF419

Attorney Emily Gaertner appeared for the State. Attorney David Patton in court for Christopher B. Pitts. Defendant Christopher B. Pitts appeared by video, in custody. Clerk. M.Burke. On state's motion this case is dismissed and read in for sentencing on 20CF503, 20CF1189, 22CF419.
Due to the trial in br 2 the PLEAH of 08/24/22 at 10:30 has been adjourned with Avery/Atty Patton to 09/15/22 at 11:00.
NO RECORD MADE.  Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Patton.  Clerk. M.Burke. PLEAH set to 08/24/22 at 10:30.

NO RECORD MADE.  Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Patton.  Clerk. M.Burke.  State in victim rights compliance. STC set to 08/17/22 at 10:30.
